items.a: All your local data (transcription history, settings, audio files) stays on your PC or gets deleted based on your preference. Nothing is synced to our servers because we do not have servers.

items.q: How do I verify the app is truly private?

items.q: What about future versions? Will privacy always be guaranteed?
items.a: Yes. Whisper Cheap is open source. If we ever added cloud features, the community would fork the project. Privacy is a core principle, not a feature.

whatIs.title: What is AI Dictation?
whatIs.subtitle: AI dictation is speech recognition technology powered by artificial intelligence that converts your speech into written text instantly.
whatIs.content: Unlike traditional dictation (like Windows Speech Recognition), modern AI dictation uses deep neural networks trained on millions of hours of audio to understand context, accents, and natural language with high accuracy. Whisper Cheap uses the optimized Parakeet V3 architecture, which runs 100% on your computer.
points: Converts your voice to text in real-time
Works completely local on your PC (no cloud uploads)

benefits.title: Benefits of Voice Typing
benefits.intro: Voice dictation is not just faster—it fundamentally changes how you think and work. Here are the key benefits.

items.title: Write 3x Faster
items.description: You speak at ~150 words per minute. You type at ~40. Dictation closes that gap dramatically.

items.title: Reduce RSI & Hand Pain
items.description: Your hands stay relaxed. Less carpal tunnel, less wrist pain, less fatigue from typing.

items.title: Capture Ideas Naturally
items.description: Your voice flows naturally. You don't lose ideas while hunting for the right words on a keyboard.

items.title: Improve Clarity
items.description: Speaking aloud forces you to organize your thoughts better. False ideas become obvious immediately.

items.title: Better Accessibility
items.description: Users with dyslexia, arthritis, or mobility issues can express themselves without pain.

items.title: Multitask Easier
items.description: Keep dictating while walking, turning your head, or changing positions. Your voice travels with you.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started (5 Minutes)
gettingStarted.intro: Setup is simple. We'll walk you through each step so you're dictating in 5 minutes.

steps.title: Choose Your Software
steps.description: Download Whisper Cheap (free, no account needed) or choose another dictation tool. We recommend Whisper Cheap because it's completely local and free.
tips: Make sure your software supports your language
Check compatibility with your apps (Word, Google Docs, etc.)
Consider privacy: is your voice uploaded to the cloud?

steps.title: Set Up Your Microphone
steps.description: Use a decent microphone. Built-in earpieces work, but a USB microphone or headset delivers better accuracy.
tips: Position the microphone 6-8 inches from your mouth
Clean earpieces regularly to remove dust
Test in a quiet environment first
Adjust volume levels in Settings

steps.title: Configure Your Settings
steps.description: Open the settings window. Choose your hotkey (Ctrl+Space is default), language, and any advanced settings like VAD (Voice Activity Detection).
tips: Customize your keyboard shortcut to something comfortable
Enable VAD to ignore background noise
Test automatic vs manual text conversion modes

steps.title: Your First Dictation
steps.description: Open a text editor (Word, Notion, Google Docs). Press your hotkey, speak clearly for 10-15 seconds, release. Text should appear instantly.
tips: Speak at a normal pace, like you're conversing
Use a natural tone (not too slow or too fast)
Try different phrases to get comfortable

bestPractices.title: Best Practices for Accuracy
bestPractices.intro: A few simple habits dramatically improve accuracy and your dictation experience.

practices.title: Speak Clear and Naturally
practices.description: You don't need to shout, but be clear. Articulate well without being robotic. Speak like you'd talk to a friend.

practices.title: Use Good Microphone Quality
practices.description: Microphone quality matters. A USB headset or dedicated microphone beats built-in earpieces. Keep it clean.

practices.title: Minimize Background Noise
practices.description: Dictate in quiet spaces. If there's noise, enable VAD in settings to ignore it. Close windows, turn off TV, silence phone.

practices.title: Dictate in Short Sessions
practices.description: Your voice gets tired. Dictate in short bursts (15-20 min), then take a break. More productive than one long session.

practices.title: Edit in a Separate Pass
practices.description: Don't try to edit while dictating. Dictate everything first in draft mode, then edit like you would typed text.

practices.title: Say Punctuation When Needed
practices.description: Say "period", "comma", "question mark" or just edit afterward. Most users find editing punctuation is fastest.

commonMistakes.title: Common Mistakes to Avoid
commonMistakes.intro: Even experienced users make these mistakes. Here's how to avoid them.

mistakes.title: Speaking Too Fast
mistakes.description: If you speak too quickly, the AI can't keep up. Words overlap or get missed.
mistakes.solution: Speak at a normal conversation pace. If you make many errors, slow down slightly.

mistakes.title: Mumbling or Unclear Speech
mistakes.description: AI needs clear sound. Mumbling, dropping sounds, or slurring causes errors.
mistakes.solution: Articulate each word clearly. Be clear without being exaggerated. Practice with short phrases.

mistakes.title: Stopping Mid-Sentence
mistakes.description: If you stop abruptly, the AI can't process the complete sentence.
mistakes.solution: Complete your thoughts. If you need a pause, make a natural one (a comma or period).

mistakes.title: Editing While Dictating
mistakes.description: Trying to correct yourself while speaking breaks your flow and confuses recognition.
mistakes.solution: Dictate everything first. Edit after in a separate pass. Your total speed is faster.

mistakes.title: Expecting Perfection
mistakes.description: AI isn't perfect. Some errors (homophones, proper names) need manual correction.
mistakes.solution: Expect 2-5% errors. It's still much faster than writing. Edit quickly afterward.

mistakes.title: Using Poor Microphone
mistakes.description: Built-in earpieces, damaged or dirty microphones significantly affect accuracy.
mistakes.solution: Invest in a decent USB microphone or headset. It's completely worth it.

advancedTips.title: Advanced Tips
advancedTips.intro: Once you master the basics, here are techniques to squeeze even more value from dictation.

tips.title: Custom Vocabularies
tips.description: Many tools (including Whisper Cheap) let you train custom vocabularies. Add specialized terms, company names, or technical jargon.

tips.title: Combine with Text Expanders
tips.description: Use a text expander (like TextExpander) alongside dictation. Type abbreviations that expand to full paragraphs. Save time on repeated phrases.

tips.title: Use Numbers & Symbols Correctly
tips.description: Say "two point five" for 2.5, "at sign" for @, "hashtag" for #. Practice to get fast at this.

tips.title: Rubber Duck Debugging
tips.description: For developers: explain your code aloud like you're talking to a rubber duck. Dictation captures the thought thread.

tips.title: Dictation for Brainstorming
tips.description: Dictation is excellent for brainstorming because you don't edit while thinking. It captures natural flow without self-criticism.

items.q: What dictation software should I use?
items.a: Several options exist. Whisper Cheap is free, local, and subscription-free. Other options include Wispr Flow (paid), Google Docs voice typing (cloud), and Dragon (expensive). Choose based on your budget, privacy needs, and requirements.

items.q: Does it work in my language?
items.a: Whisper Cheap is optimized for English and Spanish, but supports 100+ languages with good accuracy. If your language isn't supported, consider Google Docs voice typing or Wispr Flow.

items.q: How accurate is it really?
items.a: For English and Spanish, accuracy is 95-98% in clear audio. That means 2-5 errors per 100 words, still much faster than typing and editing after. Errors decrease with better microphone and practice.

items.q: Can I use dictation for professional work?
items.a: Absolutely. Many writers, lawyers, doctors, and professionals rely on dictation. Just ensure you use a private/local tool if handling sensitive information.

items.q: How long does it take to get comfortable?
items.a: Most users feel comfortable in 1-2 sessions. Your speed increases after a week of regular practice. After a month, many users are faster dictating than typing.

items.q: Can I use dictation for coding?
items.a: Not for code syntax (that's what keyboards are for). But yes for documentation, comments, commit messages, and technical writing. Extremely useful.

items.q: Does it work on phone?
items.a: Whisper Cheap is Windows-only. But most phones have built-in dictation (iOS Siri, Android Google Assistant). Some services like Wispr Flow offer mobile apps.

items.q: Is it safe?
items.a: Depends on your software. Local tools like Whisper Cheap are safest (your voice never leaves your PC). Cloud services like Wispr Flow depend on their privacy policy.
